sources.title: Born to Speed (1947) RACE CAR DRAMA
sources.description:
Movie Class by PizzaFLIX: Johnny Sands (1928-2003) was discovered on his way to the beach by a talent scout, and chose his professional name for his love of sand and surf. Sands, who made his first screen appearance in Orson Welles' THE STRANGER (1946), is best remembered for his role in THE BACHELOR AND THE BOBBY-SOXER (1947).

Stars: Johnny Sands, Vivian Austin, Don Castle 
Director: Edward L. Cahn

The romantic and dangerous world of professional midget auto racing provides the backdrop for this dramatic tale of a young driver who decides to follow in his late fatherâ€™s footsteps and win the big race.

metadata.Plot: Johnny Randall, a young race-car driver, falls in love with Tony Bradley, who hates racing because her brother was killed in a midget car-race (the car size, not the driver-size.) To compound that, his mother also objects because his father was killed while racing in the Indianapolis 500. But he continues racing, even though he narrowly escapes death when a rival-and-jealous racer schemes to get rid of him. Then, after these narrow escapes, he loses his nerve, but enters one last race. Is there a gas-station ownership in his future?
metadata.Writer: Robert B. Churchill, Crane Wilbur, Scott Darling
metadata.Actors: Johnny Sands, Vivian Austin, Don Castle
